title: Conservation of energy - block launched by spring

content.question: At time <math alttext="t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, a block is held at rest against a compressed horizontal spring, as shown. The total mechanical energy of the block-spring-Earth system is <math alttext="E sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The block is then released, slides down the track, and is traveling on a flat section of the track at time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The total mechanical energy of the block-spring-Earth system at time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is <math alttext="E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Friction between the block and the track is negligible. Which of the following is true of <math alttext="E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="E sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub 1 is less than E sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="E sub 1 equals E sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="E sub 1 is greater than open parenthesis, E sub 0 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="E sub 1 is greater than E sub 0, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="E sub 1 equals E sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
